intro: Verbesina polycephala, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble a crown, which are composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, also known as the daisy or sunflower family, and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Verbesina polycephala is known for its ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
